newsitem.title: USA: Technology trade publisher CMP files for IPO.
newsitem.headline: Technology trade publisher CMP files for IPO.

text.p: Computer industry trade publisher CMP Media Group, whose stable of magazines and newspapers include Information Week, Communications Week and Electronic Engineering Times, has filed for $115 million initial public offering.
Goldman Sachs & Co will be the lead underwriter of the offering, according to documents filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Friday.
A source at CMP said there had been rumblings about an IPO for some time prompted by some business restructurings that seemed to be a fine-tuning ahead of an IPO.

CMP's EE Times Online broke news last week that Intel Corp's Pentium II chips may have a technical bug that causes computational errors when during certain obscure calculations. EE Times was also one of the first to report in 1994 that Intel Corp's Pentium chips had a similar problem, a glitch that caused the company to take a $475 million charge.
The company, controlled by the Leeds family, also publishes Computer Reseller News.

But despite its prestigious titles and 1996 revenues of $418 million, the Long Island technology publisher is dwarfed by rivals Ziff-Davis and International Data Group (IDG), the industry's number one and two, respectively.
Ziff-Davis is the computer publishing arm of Japanese computer power Softbank Corp, which owns a sizeable stake in Yahoo! Inc, publishes the Red Herring monthly magazine and runs conferences.
